cyclone.name: CRISTOBAL
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles NW of Ciudad del Carmen, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift near the southern Bay of Campeche coast, then turn north-northeast and accelerate northward across the Gulf of Mexico toward the central Louisiana coast late this weekend.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect only for Mexico from Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz (Mexico)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest risk presently from eastern Texas coast eastward across Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama coasts
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late weekend with peak gusts generally below tropical-storm strength (20-30 mph).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal rise under 2 ft possible due to long-fetch easterly flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 2â€“4 inches of rain to the Galveston area late Saturday through Monday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Localized minor flooding in low-lying areas if heavier bands stall.
